result.execSummary:
The defendant LeDarius Marcel Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Domestic Abuse Crime, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 188 DAYS time served.

miscConds.notes:
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment subject to any applicable collection procedures. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
-Court WAIVES all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

-No contact with firearms.
-Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

-No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
-Third party contact for purposes of time with the children.

-Batterers Intervention program.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-Provide DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. LeDarius Marcel Coleman

defendant.name: Coleman, LeDarius Marcel
defendant.address: 9410 West Silver Spring Drive, #1, Milwaukee, WI 53225

records.addlTxt:
Defendant LeDarius Marcel Coleman in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for LeDarius Marcel Coleman.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing hearing held. Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 YEARS AND 6 MONTHS, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 188 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR AND 6 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 90 DAYS of condition time, as to count 1. Huber privileges for work.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
-Third party contact for purposes of time with the children.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-DV assessment imposed.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment subject to any applicable collection procedures. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
-Court WAIVES all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant LeDarius Marcel Coleman not in court, in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Court is in trial and unable to hear this case.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant LeDarius Marcel Coleman in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant LeDarius Marcel Coleman in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea hearing held.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court REINSTATES defendant's communication privileges. State to submit a proposed order to the Court. Case adjourned to Branch 29 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant LeDarius Marcel Coleman not in court, in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Due to court calendar congestion, jury trial on 6/21/22 is converted to a plea hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant LeDarius Marcel Coleman not in court, in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a final pre-trial. Defense counsel requests a plea hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant LeDarius Marcel Coleman not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a final pre-trial.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Parties request an adjourned final pre-trial.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant LeDarius Marcel Coleman not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel is in trial in another court and requests an adjourned final pre-trial.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant LeDarius Marcel Coleman in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant LeDarius Marcel Coleman in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Case in court on State's motion to rescind communication privileges. Arguments heard. Court GRANTS State's request and ORDERS defendant's telephone, visitatoin, and U.S. mail custody privileges RESCINDED. Order signed and filed. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29. This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Defendant LeDarius Marcel Coleman in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant LeDarius Marcel Coleman in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MKE County Investigator Michael Wilkerson. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State requests a bail/bond hearing. Bail/bond hearing set for 4/18/22 at 8:30 am. Parties notified via email.

Defendant LeDarius Marcel Coleman in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant LeDarius Marcel Coleman in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  LeDarius Marcel Coleman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
